description: A look at what stories are trending across the west of England on Monday 3 March 2025.
title: West of England headlines: Funds raised after dog attack death
title_page: West of England headlines: Funds raised after dog attack death - BBC News
maintext:
Thousands of pounds have been raised in memory of teenager Morgan Dorsett, who died in a suspected XL bully attack, external. The Shropshire Star reports that the fundraiser has hit £3,300.
A walker had to go to hospital after being knocked over on Berrow beach by a dog on Sunday, reports Burnham-on-Sea.com, external.
Josh Dury's photo capturing "all the planets in the solar system", external has gone all over the world, and done well for several of our outlets.
There will be two "huge bridge beams" heading to the A417 Missing Link on Monday, external.
"Never say never" – Ilona Maher has played her last game for Bristol Bears, external… for now. But could she be back?
Swindon Borough Council wants to ban e-bikes and e-scooters from the town centre, external and Broadgreen via a public space protection order.
A road in Warminster is shut until 30 April between 1700 and 0500 to make it safe for frogs, newts and toads to cross, external.
